headline.main: Al Gross, Inventor of Gizmos With Potential, Dies at 82

lead_paragraph: Al Gross, also known as Phineas Thaddeus Veeblefetzer, granddaddy of citizens' band radio, who tinkered with all manner of electronic gear before people just had to have them, died on Dec. 21 at a hospice in Sun City, Ariz., his hometown. He was 82. Mr. Gross died after a brief illness, said Ethel Stanka Gross, his wife and sole immediate survivor.
abstract: Al Gross, also known as Phineas Thaddeus Veeblefetzer, inventor of electronic gizmos, dies at age 82; photo (M)
